data.instructions: A user has been assigned a privileged role, which may indicate unauthorized privilege escalation or administrative misuse.
Gather details of all users - (By adding sheet to this excel)
Username, Role Assigned, Time of Assignment, Initiator, Source IP, Location
Determine if the assigned role is high-risk (e.g., Global Admin)
Look for unusual sign-in patterns by the assigned user for last 7 days

data.input details: Observed the Events and checked user(Adminchintala) was accessed into MS-PIM, nothing Suspicious activities found, closing as FP.
data.instructions: Validate if the assigning user had legitimate access and permissions
data.reviewer comments: Check the Historical data of initiator  & alerts on initiator

data.instructions: if suspicious, escalate to L3/IT for investigation
data.reviewer comments: If  initiator  found compromise then Escalte to L3

data.inputs required: if True Positive - Inform to IT Team to Reset the account, Revoke the MFA tokens, Temporary disable the account
data.instructions: Reach out to the Network/EDR teams to block the detected suspicious IP, Inform user to reset password, maintain complex password and enable MFA.
data.reviewer comments: Also Reset the all actvie user sessions  & Need to perform user precompromise & post compromise  actvity

data.instructions: After all the investigation document the steps taken, findings, and any remediation actions required

data.input details:
These indicate malicious or unauthorized role assignments:
Attacker assigns themselves or another compromised account to a privileged role (e.g., Global Admin).
Privileged role assigned outside business hours from an unusual IP or geolocation.
Role assignment follows a successful risky sign-in (e.g., impossible travel or TOR exit node).
Assignment made by an unknown or suspicious app/service principal.
Multiple privileged roles assigned in quick succession—suggesting lateral movement.
Assignment to a dormant or deactivated account suddenly re-enabled.

These are unusual but legitimate actions:
Privileged role assigned temporarily via PIM (Privileged Identity Management) for a valid task.
Security team grants temporary access for an urgent incident response.
Admin assigns a role to a new hire during onboarding, but outside normal hours.
Role assignment from a new IP due to remote work or travel.

These are normal operations that trigger alerts unnecessarily:
Admin assigns a role to a user as part of routine access management.
Assignment from a known corporate IP or trusted device, but not yet whitelisted.
Bulk role assignments during a migration or reorganization.
Temporary elevation via PIM that’s not filtered out in the rule logic.
